ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: At what point in the study was this information collected?
Notes: 0 = Baseline; 1 = 8 Weeks; 2 = 16-18 Weeks; 3 = 36 weeks

ElementDescription: How your child's problems affect his or her relationship with playmates
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: Regardless of whether your child is popular or unpopular with peers, does he or she have a special close "best friend" that he or she has kept for more than a few months
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Does your child have siblings?
Notes: 0 = My child does not have siblings; 1 = My child has siblings; 2 = My child does not have regular contact with siblings

ElementDescription: How your child's problems affect his or her relationship with brothers or sisters
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: How your child's affect his or her relationship with you (and a parenting partner if present)
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: How your child's problems affect his or her academic progress at school
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: How your child's problems affect his or her self esteem
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: How your child's problems affect your family in general
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: Overall severity of your child's problem in the functioning and overall need for treatment
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

ElementDescription: How this child's problems affect his or her relationships with other children
Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment

Notes: 0 = No problem, definitely does not need treatment; 6 = Extreme problem, definitely needs treatment
